snippet: Much of the Earth’s population growth is in sub-Saharan African nations like Nigeria, where trends that have lowered birthrates elsewhere have not yet caught on.
abstract: Nigeria's booming population, which may exceed 300 million people in a quarter-century, is emblematic of a wider population problem across sub-Saharan Africa; trends that have reduced fertility rates elsewhere in the developing world have not yet caught on, and population has quickly outstripped economic expansion; Nigeria has now become a crucial test case for government efforts to reduce the birthrate, including free contraceptives.
lead_paragraph: Much of the Earth’s population growth is in sub-Saharan African nations like Nigeria, where trends that have lowered birthrates elsewhere have not yet caught on.

headline.seo: In Nigeria, a Preview of an Overcrowded Planet
headline.main: Nigeria Tested by Rapid Rise in Population
headline.print_headline: Nigeria’s Population Is Soaring In Preview of a Global Problem
